Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 5th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1973...
Traded from Minnesota to New York (N) on 1/31/1977 (Going to NYM: SS R. Yount, P D. Warthen. Going to MIN: 2B R. Smith, SS R. Carew)...
Had first career hit on 4/1/1977, off Dennis Daboll (CIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/15/1977, off Tug McGraw (SF)...
Won Rookie of the Year Award in 1977, hitting .277 with 5 HR, 50 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Pittsburgh on 5/10/1979...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1981...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1983...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/26/1984, hitting .542 with 2 HR, 8 RBI...
Injured on 9/2/1984 with a Fractured Jaw, out for 4 weeks...
Injured on 7/17/1985 with a Tight Shoulder, out for one week...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1985...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
Won World Series with New York (N) in 1987...
Was selected to the 1988 Allstar game...
Traded from New York (N) to Boston on 3/2/1989 (Going to NYM: P K. Bottenfield. Going to BOS: SS R. Yount)...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Had 2000th career hit on 7/25/1989, off Bud Black (BAL)...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against California on 9/25/1989...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1989...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Baltimore on 6/27/1991...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1991...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1992...
Drafted in 3rd round, 56th overall pick, by Houston in 1997...
Released by Houston on 3/2/1997...
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (N) on 3/2/1997 to a 1-year deal worth $436,000 per year...
Earned first career win on 4/5/1997...
